text: [Music]
hi I'm Pavan icloud Support Engineer
here at a SS office Bangalore India
today I'm going to show you how you can
share an encrypted Amazon EBS volume
with another a SS account let's get
started
although it's not possible to share this
resources directly we can achieve this
requirement by creating snapshots and
sharing them with destination at a place
account one thing to note is that you
can't share the encrypted snapshots with
another account if the AWS key used is a
default one however you can change the
kms key of a snapshot from default to
custom and then share it in this video
I'll show the process of changing the
kms key and sharing the encrypted
snapshot after logging into the AWS
management console navigate to the ec2
console
from the side panel choose snapshots
here I already have a snapshot which is
encrypted with the default kms key to
change the encryption key that is being
used we need to copy the snapshot and
then during the process we need to
update the kms key select the snapshot
go to actions and then choose copy
in the copy snapshot console select the
appropriate key under the master key
section
choose copy the new snapshot will have
the updated key
to share with the target account select
the snapshot and then choose actions and
then modify permissions
in the radius account ID in the account
number section and then choose add
permission
save it now we will move to the IM
console to grant the target with
appropriate permissions
now we are in the I am console we'll
start editing the permissions on the
custom key select encryption key choose
the key used for snapshot encryption
earlier
in the key policy section choose
external accounts and add the account
number you are sharing this map shot
with
and then choose Save Changes now you'll
be able to launch a volume out of the
shade snapshot in the target account let
us go and check the snapshot in the
target account
navigate to the Amazon ec2 console
from the side panel choose a snapshot
section select the private snapshots
here you can see the shade snapshot to
avoid dependency on the owner kms key
you can copy to your own account and
then during the process select your own
KMS key select a snapshot and then
choose actions and choose create volume
thanks for watching and happy
being from all of us here at aw
[Music]
